headline: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots—think C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6—are getting closer by the year.  At 2025’s CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world’s attention.  At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

content.title: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
content.summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots—think C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6—are getting closer by the year.  At 2025’s CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world’s attention.  At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

headline: Tesla’s Pivot To Robots And Robotaxis Tests Rich Valuation And Merger Hopes
summary: Tesla (NasdaqGS:TSLA) is discontinuing its long running Model S and Model X vehicles to free up capacity for Optimus humanoid robots and robotaxi production. The company has outlined an initial rollout schedule for Optimus units and robotaxi services that targets 2026 for broader deployment. Following SpaceX’s acquisition of xAI, Tesla’s links to Elon Musk’s wider tech group have deepened, fueling discussion about a possible future mega merger involving Tesla, SpaceX, and xAI. Tesla, with a...

headline: BYD’s $60 Billion Wipeout Points to Deeper Turmoil for China EVs
summary: BYD’s Hong Kong-listed shares are down this week after disappointing sales data, extending a selloff that has shaved off more than $60 billion in market value since May. The slump reverberated across EV peers, compounding woes for a stock market also grappling with fresh concerns over taxes and business disruption from artificial intelligence.  Adding to the strain, soaring costs for battery materials and memory chips are likely to squeeze automakers’ margins even further.

content.title: BYD’s $60 Billion Wipeout Points to Deeper Turmoil for China EVs
content.summary: BYD’s Hong Kong-listed shares are down this week after disappointing sales data, extending a selloff that has shaved off more than $60 billion in market value since May. The slump reverberated across EV peers, compounding woes for a stock market also grappling with fresh concerns over taxes and business disruption from artificial intelligence.  Adding to the strain, soaring costs for battery materials and memory chips are likely to squeeze automakers’ margins even further.

headline: Tesla Weighs New York, Arizona, Idaho to Lift Solar Cell Output
summary: The company is evaluating multiple sites across the US to begin manufacturing solar cells, according to people familiar with the matter, turning what sounded like a moonshot just weeks ago into an active industrial push.  One component of the plan: expanding production at its Buffalo, New York, factory, said the people, who weren’t authorized to speak publicly.  Capacity there could reach 10 gigawatts, they said, which would be equivalent to 10 nuclear plants.

content.title: Tesla Weighs New York, Arizona, Idaho to Lift Solar Cell Output
content.summary: The company is evaluating multiple sites across the US to begin manufacturing solar cells, according to people familiar with the matter, turning what sounded like a moonshot just weeks ago into an active industrial push.  One component of the plan: expanding production at its Buffalo, New York, factory, said the people, who weren’t authorized to speak publicly.  Capacity there could reach 10 gigawatts, they said, which would be equivalent to 10 nuclear plants.

headline: This Week In Electric Vehicles - India's Road to Electric Truck Transformation
summary: India's commercial vehicle sector is rapidly transitioning towards electric mobility, spurred by declining battery costs and supportive government policies. The electrification of medium- and heavy-duty trucks (MDTs and HDTs) is identified as a key strategy in reducing carbon emissions and enhancing energy efficiency. By 2040, India plans to deploy over 250,000 electric trucks, with a significant focus on high-capacity depot-based charging infrastructure to meet increased power demands. This...

headline: Facing high Trump tariffs, Africa's leading economy says it's close to a new trade deal with China
summary: China and South Africa signed a framework agreement for a new trade deal on Friday as Africa's leading economy looks to other options following the high import tariffs imposed on it by the U.S. and its diplomatic fallout with the Trump administration.  The ministry said it expected the trade deal to be finalized by the end of March.

content.title: Facing high Trump tariffs, Africa's leading economy says it's close to a new trade deal with China
content.summary: China and South Africa signed a framework agreement for a new trade deal on Friday as Africa's leading economy looks to other options following the high import tariffs imposed on it by the U.S. and its diplomatic fallout with the Trump administration.  The ministry said it expected the trade deal to be finalized by the end of March.

headline: Is Elon Musk Giving Index Funds FOMO?
summary: Buying and holding index funds is one of the smartest things investors can do, but it’s hard.  Owning pieces of America’s largest companies via an S&P 500 fund isn’t exactly the same thing as owning “the market” because some rising stars haven’t qualified for membership yet.  When it looks like they’re about to join, those shares can get a turbo boost right before index funds are forced to buy.

content.title: Is Elon Musk Giving Index Funds FOMO?
content.summary: Buying and holding index funds is one of the smartest things investors can do, but it’s hard.  Owning pieces of America’s largest companies via an S&P 500 fund isn’t exactly the same thing as owning “the market” because some rising stars haven’t qualified for membership yet.  When it looks like they’re about to join, those shares can get a turbo boost right before index funds are forced to buy.

headline: A Key Takeaway From Earnings Season: Signs of Consumer Weakness
summary: Earnings season is more than halfway over, and a clear laggard is emerging: companies that sell non-essential items to consumers.  A high ratio of companies—38%—have also missed consensus earnings forecasts.  The sector covers a broad swathe of the economy, encompassing a range of companies from Amazon and DoorDash to Tractor Supply and Marriott.

headline: Big Tech's $600 billion spending plans exacerbate investors' AI headache
summary: A planned $600 billion artificial intelligence spending splurge by big tech firms in 2026 is adding to investor unease as they assess the implications for profitability as well ​as a potential existential threat to software firms.  Shares of Amazon, which had announced a $200 billion capital expenditure outlay, slid 7% ‌on Friday while Alphabet lost 3% after the company said on Wednesday that capital spending could double this year.

content.title: Big Tech's $600 billion spending plans exacerbate investors' AI headache

Shares of Amazon, which had announced a $200 billion capital expenditure outlay, slid 7% ‌on Friday while Alphabet lost 3% after the company said on Wednesday that capital spending could double this year.

headline: Elon Musk, The World's Richest Man, Says 'Money Can't Buy Happiness' — While 88% of Americans Struggle With Financial Stress
summary: "Money can't buy happiness" is the kind of thing people usually say after buying everything else. And last week, Elon Musk — the richest man in the world — said it too. In a post on X on Wednesday, Musk wrote: "Whoever said ‘money can't buy happiness' really knew what they were talking about" — and added a sad emoji at the end.
